results.title: Chicks With Decks
results.brief_description: A documentary about teenage Australian girls with a love for skateboards and making rhymes. This student work features spectacular skateboarding footage.

results.title: Chicks and chickens
results.brief_description: Follows the incubation and hatching of a brood of chicks, and shows a hen as she protects her chicks and teaches them to find food. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Chicken soup with rice
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Riss, Weston Woods Studios and Maurice Sendak
results.brief_description: An excerpt from “Really Rosie”. Features a song about chicken soup with rice as a unifying theme to present an illustrated tour of the months of the year. Adapted from the children’s book, “The Nutshell kids” by Maurice Sendak. Music composed and performed by Carole King. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Chicago: urban renewal
results.brief_description: Introduced by Geoffrey Edge, this film is concerned with the process of urban renewal and the problem it poses. It focuses upon one of a series of schemes which have been carried out in Chicago’s South Side since the Second World War. The scheme, in the South Commons area, attempts to achieve a mix of black and white residents and a wide range of income groups.

results.title: Chicago: midland metropolis
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes the physical and social characteristics of a metropolitan region as exemplified by Chicago. Shows how the people live and work, explains why the Chicago region became a major urban area, and examines some of the critical problems of urban development and the efforts of city planners to solve them.
